reviewText: Featured on DANGEROUS CURVES are several country music stars and one former heavyweight boxing champion. Here's your chance to take the highway to adventure with good buddies like Tom Selleck and Jerry Reed-- and don't forget to bring along your guitar!SYNOPSES:"C.B. Hustlers" - Ladies who cater to OTR truckers provide a special sort of "rest stop" when needed."The Concrete Cowboys" - An ex-cowboy and sidekick travel America in search of adventure. This one has an outstanding cast of country music artists, including the legendary Roy Acuff."Hijack" - Truckers hauling a mysterious cargo from Los Angeles to Houston face numerous hazards while trying to complete their mission."Moonfire" - Big-riggers battle a Nazi who's hiding out in Mexico. Subplot involves the disappearance of a reclusive billionaire.For some crazy countrified comedy, you've just gotta check out theRURAL FOLK 4 MOVIE SET. It's a hoot 'n a holler!.Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website.(2.2) C.B. Hustlers (1978) - Edward Roehm/Tiffany Jones/John F. Goff(4.4) The Concrete Cowboys (TV-1979) - Tom Selleck/Jerry Reed/Barbara Mandrell/Claude Akins/Roy Acuff/Ray Stevens/Red West(6.0) Hijack (TV-1973) - David Janssen/Keenan Wynn/Jeanette Nolan/William Schallert(7.9) Moonfire (1972) - Charles Napier/Sonny Liston/Richard Egan/Marty Robbins

reviewText: I liked the trucker movies, the old white freightliner driven by David Jansen, and the red mack cabover, driven by sonny listen. They are good entertainment, but I did not even watch the "detective" movie with tom selleck, it is kind od out of place in this pack. Otherwise, it was cheap entertainment.

reviewText: MoonFire. Good trucker movie, although a Little Wacky.. at times. The Truck on the movie cover IS WRONG..on amazon shows a Peterbilt on the cover, the movie is long.the plot silly. and the main character is missing for half the movie only to reappear at the end? wtf. ? other than these minute details that are bothersome. the movie is a good Trucker movie with lots of cool trucks. the main ones being Mack Trucks.

reviewText: Veteran character actor Charles Napier pairs up with Sonny Liston (who comes in really handy in a fistfight with bikers!) in "Moonfire" (also known as "Moonfire Trucker,") one of the most bizarrely plotted of all the trucker movies that came out of the 1970s. Director (and writer) Michael Parkhurst has a ton of subplots going on here, all revolving around a secret satellite system named "Moonfire" and nearly incomprehensible intrigue in Mexico.The movie opens with a murder and hijacking in Mexico that starts the film off with a warning shot foreshadowing the present day better than Parkhurst could ever have predicted. The Moonfire aircraft maker send Napier and Liston on a scavenger hunt across the desert southwest on a top secret mission related to a manned spacecraft flown by Richard Bull (who you will recognize from numerous television shows like "Mannix" and "Barnaby Jones," and in a related turn of events even "Movin' On,") and who now is a hostage in a secret Mexican facility run by an escaped Nazi. This leads inevitably to the highlight of the film, a truly preposterous "when plots collide" highway rescue and forklift duel. How does all this work out? Well, you'll just have to watch the movie, but relax, it's actually strangely interesting.The film is a B-movie trucker film from an era that was overflowing with them, but this one has such weird motivations and such an utterly wacky plot that it's enjoyable for what it is. Liston is not an actor, and Napier is none too subtle here either, but the duo is fun to watch, though frequent discussions (especially via CB radio) expose painful dialogue, though I did enjoy Napier's rant about the bloated federal bureaucracy: perhaps again Parkhurst was once again just ahead of his time. There's lots of footage of trucks on the road and vintage airplanes too, if you are so inclined to enjoy such things."Moonfire" is a trucker movie like no other: if you want a bit of over-the-road cheese, this is definitely on the menu.
summary: Charles Napier, Sonny Liston, Trucks, Bikers, And Even A Secret Mexican Missile Launch Complex!
